content: Spustite Thunderbird v NÚDZOVOM režime (zakázať všetky doplnky a nastaviť ovládacie prvky na predvolené hodnoty) a preverte či problém pretrváva. Na spustenie programu do núdzového režimu môžete použiť odkazy v ponuke Windows- Štart (WIN+R) - Spustiť a tu vypíšte: thunderbird -safe-mode alebo priamo z menu Thunderbird - Pomocník - Režim riešenia problémov https://support.mozilla.org/cs/kb/nouzovy-rezim-thunderbirdu http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/07/21/Thunderbird_nudzovy_rezim0.jpg

content:
Kliknite na dlaždicu "Dátum" , ktorá sa zobrazuje nad prvým emailom hore. Kliknite ešte raz a ešte raz. Ktorá pozícia zoradenia vám vyhovuje tú si ponechajte. Vypnite Thunderbird. Po zapnutí Thunderbidru budú najnovšie správy v tomto priečinku zoradené uspodu zoznamu.

Tento príznak zoradenia bude treba nastaviť aj v ostatných priečinkoch, v ktorých chcete aby najnovšie správy v priečinku boli zoradené uspodu zoznamu.
creator: Ansamb

content: Dobrý den, uvedený postup mi v dané instalaci nefunguje. Dlaždice Datum sice reaguje a zprávy zůstávají uspořádané podle datumu (sestupně nebo vzestupně) případně podle příznaku nepřečtené tak jak chci, ale po ukončení TB a nebo přepnutí do jiné složky zpráv a návratu zpět je posuvník nastaven zcela nahoru nebo někam náhodně doprostřed a abych viděl poslední dnešní zprávy, musím rolovacím kolečkem a nebo posuvníkem zajet dolů na poslední zprávu ručně.
creator: palca1

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Ak problém nepominie vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť odkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete vrátiť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... - zvolte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.
creator: Ansamb

content: Jenom doplním informaci, že stejný problém se stejným chováním má i kolegyně na jiném PC, obojí vzniklo v okamžiku přechodu na Supernovu. Pak by to znamenalo, že profil poškozuje samotná aktualizace.

content: Je pravdepodobné, že ste mali narušený profil Thunderbirdu už pred prechodom na Supernovu.

content: Chybovou konzoli jsme našel. Error2 je konzole běžícího systému, který trochu zlobí. Error3 je konzole nového profilu, který se snaží importovat data. Na disku došlo místo. Původní profil má 48GB dat, nový profil spadne když dosáhne 20GB a na disku serveru už není prostor.
creator: palca1

content: Možná se tě týká tento limit 4 GB v Thunderbirdu.
creator: poljos-moz

content:
Zdravím. Vytvoření nového profilu a import všech dat proběhly, prostředí jsem nastavil a chování zůstalo stejné. I když mám nastavené, aby se zprávy řadily podle data (vzestupně) a dle příznaku přečtené, po přechodu do jiné složky a návratu do hlavní složky zpráv, kurzor (aktuální zobrazení zpráv) se opět nastaví někam na začátek nebo doprostřed roku 2021 místo na poslední aktuální zprávu. Při jakékoliv manipulaci s poštou tedy musíme posouvat posuvník vpravo někam z horní nebo prostřední pozice na spodní doraz, abychom se dostali k posledním zprávám.

Dle mého názoru, programátor při úpravách programu při přechodu na verzi Supernova, vůbec neuvažoval variantu používání, kdy jsou aktuální zpracovávané maily zobrazeny na spodní části seznamu, protože při obráceném řazení (sestupně), kdy jsou poslední zprávy zobrazovány nahoře, se systém chová očekávaným způsobem.
creator: palca1

content: Po 4 měsících zkoušek a čekání je situace na všech počítačích ve firmě stejná. Profily poškozené nejsou. Řazení čistě podle datumu příjmu zprávy funguje správně, dle očekávání, a to i při přechodu mezi různými složkami. Kurzor se při přechodu mezi složkami vždy nastaví na poslední zprávu (ať už je mám seřazené sestupně nebo vzestupně). Proti tomu - jakmile se klikne na řazení podle příznaku "přečtenosti", složka je sice řazená tak jak chceme , tedy nejprve nahoře staré a přečtené a úplně dole nepřečtené a taky seřazené podle datumu, jenomže jakmile kliknu na jinou složku a vrátím se zpátky, kurzor se nastaví na PRVNÍ řádek a na obrazovce se zobrazí NAHOŘE, NEJSTARŠÍ a PŘEČTENÉ zprávy, místo DOLE, NEJNOVĚJŠÍCH a NEPŘEČTENÝCH. Takže toto je chyba defaultního chování, programátorská chyba. PROSÍM O OPRAVU !
creator: palca1

content:
I suggest going back to the details: - Thunderbird should NOT be running on either PC - copy the profile from the ...appdata\thunderbird folder - copy to the same location on new PC. There should be warnings of overlaying existing files. Allow that - start Thunderbird on new PC and all should be there.

If the copy takes place while Thunderbird is running, the proper files are not set properly.
creator: davidsk

content: I have done this all the time. Making very sure the programm is not running at the time i copy and paste the files. Only after pasting it in the right folder let thunderbird run. Also tried pasting it and restart the laptop before opening the programm. None of it works but thanks for the support!
creator: feymonsan

content: This works 100% of the time, so something is not happening. You can check this in Windows FIle Explorer. - look inside the profile after copying from old PC. A POP account will be in the Mail folder and IMAP accounts in the Imapmail folder. - do this again on new PC after copying to new PC. the profile folder name should be the same as it was on old PC. - start Thunderbird and click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' . You should now be in the profile you just looked at, same name. Look in the Mail and Imapmail folders to see what is there. - report here any differences in those checks. And, just to be clear, the profile you copy FROM is c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird and the location you are copying TO is c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming

content:
> I've removed the account and restarted from scratch. > All messages appear for 1 or 2 days, then it deletes all the messages from 3 days ago to 2018, six years ago.

To really start from scratch you would probably want to create a new profile. Note also, uninstalling and reinstalling changes no settings.

> TB is not picking up mail on the Gmail server. > TB is deleting, permanently, mail on the Gmail server without my instruction.

If it's really not getting mail, it also cannot delete those message it hasn't gotten. All activity from Thunderbird will be shown in Thunderbird's Activity Manager.

So sorry you are still having trouble, but I'm not seeing any open nor bug reports created in the past year which match your issue https://mzl.la/47j2hwL. The only conclusion I come to is something in your environment is causing this.

content: This issue is usually because the two SMTP servers are crossed. Check the name of the selected outgoing server at bottom of the account pane. Then click account settings and scroll down left side to 'outgoing servers SMTP and check description names of each of the two servers to confirm that they are not crossed, and also verify that the proper email id is in each smtp server setting. If unsure, then post four screenshots: two of the account panes and two of the smtp server panes. thankyou

creator: lzweig1

content: What has changed in recent months is that email providers are tightening up on security. When a server is asked to process an email from xxx@com and the smtp server says if from zzz@com, the receiving server suspects spam and rejects the message. I have been seeing this issue for past several months. I have also seen a rise in demanding secure connections, such as ssl/tls or starttls, as appropriate. Do not uninstall TB. Just create an smtp server for each account and give a unique description so when you click the account page to select the smtp server, you will be assured that you're connecting to the right one.

content:
David - Success!

It appears the only change that was required was to change the outgoing server from NONE to STARTTLS which I guess is from an unsecured to a secured server? The incoming port of 110 and outgoing port of 587 were correct.

So thank you and do you have any thoughts on why this was necessary or what may have caused the required change?

content:
Please check in Thunderbird to see if a setting needs switching on.

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say 'TRUE'

Now Do this: In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'

A new window opens showing the contents of your 'profile name' folder. This puts you in the correct location to do the following.

  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.

I'm going to give the full instructions because I do not know if people already know how to create and use a userChrome.css file.

  • In the 'profile name ' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'.

Note if you already have a 'userChrome.css' file then you may only need to copy the actual code section from where it says 'Message Header area' 

@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css"); @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  /*Message Header area - */  .message-header-container, .message-header-extra-container {  row-gap: 1px  !important; }
  • Save the file as 'userChrome.css' - note the spelling of this is important - all lower case except the C.
  • Save it in the 'chrome' folder. - see attached image as guide.

Check that file really is called 'userChrome.css' and not 'userChrome.css.txt' - it has to be saved as a Cascading Style Sheet (css) and not a text document. So if you see 'userChrome.css.txt' - no problem - just rename it by removing the .txt - you will get ask are you sure as it may effect things - just say yes because you really do want to do it.

Start Thunderbird
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If you want to remove all the buttons in the Message Header area because you have added them to the 'Unified Toolbar' then the following section of code can be added to the 'userChrome.css' file.

Remember to exit Thunderbird before editing the 'userChrome.css' file 

/* hide all the buttons in the message header toolbar */  #header-view-toolbar { display: none !important; }
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Here is another alternative:

This code only shows a small Message Pane Header area. Depending upon your width of window: It should show the 'Reply' etc buttons and if wide enough also display the 'From'. So this is a very much reduced height and therefore potentially offers a significant increase in Message Pane email content area. However, on hover it should display more of the header data like TO, Subject and Date. So this displays as and when required.

These px sizes work for me using screen resolution 1920 x 1080 Scale 100% Font Size : 12px default and Density: Compact

content:
Toad-Hall said
Please check in Thunderbird to see if a setting needs switching on.
  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button
  • In search type : legacy
  • look for this line: toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets
  • If it is set as 'false' :
  • click on the far right arrow type icon to toggle from 'false' to say 'TRUE'
Now Do this: In Thunderbird
  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • in 'Application Basics' - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'
A new window opens showing the contents of your 'profile name' folder. This puts you in the correct location to do the following.
  • Exit Thunderbird now. This is important.
I'm going to give the full instructions because I do not know if people already know how to create and use a userChrome.css file.
  • In the 'profile name ' folder create a new folder and call it 'chrome'. The spelling is important - note it is all lower case.
  • Then open a simple text editor program such as 'Notepad'.
  • Copy all the text between the lines below and paste it into 'Notepad'.
Note if you already have a 'userChrome.css' file then you may only need to copy the actual code section from where it says 'Message Header area' 
@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css"); @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  /*Message Header area - */  .message-header-container, .message-header-extra-container {  row-gap: 1px  !important; }
  • Save the file as 'userChrome.css' - note the spelling of this is important - all lower case except the C.
  • Save it in the 'chrome' folder. - see attached image as guide.

Check that file really is called 'userChrome.css' and not 'userChrome.css.txt' - it has to be saved as a Cascading Style Sheet (css) and not a text document. So if you see 'userChrome.css.txt' - no problem - just rename it by removing the .txt - you will get ask are you sure as it may effect things - just say yes because you really do want to do it.

Start Thunderbird

Where do I copy from & paste to to change the size of the header? I created the chrome file for moving the message header from another thread. I'm hoping my photo explains what is in the chrome file right now and what I am hoping to accomplish. Do I just add to the same file?
creator: TVCakeLady

content:
You add to the same userChrome.css file. You must exit Thunderbird before you do it.

As previously mentioned : Note if you already have a 'userChrome.css' file then you may only need to copy the actual code section from where it says 'Message Header area'

This means your userChrome.css file should look like this: 

@import url("chrome://messenger/content/unifiedtoolbar/unifiedToolbarWebextensions.css"); @namespace html url("http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml");  /* Thread pane - reduce min-height*/  #threadPane {  min-height: 100px !important; }  /*Message Header area - */  .message-header-container, .message-header-extra-container {  row-gap: 1px  !important; }

Additional info: The problem regarding reducing height of thread Pane was reported as a bug issue:

  • https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1855611

Latest info is it has been fixed, but it's still in the beta stage. At some point it should get into the normal release versions in the near future.

Your 'userChrome.css' file will continue to override the code for the thread pane. But when the new code arrives in the release version, it means you can edit the 'userchrome.css' file and remove that 'thread pane' section if you want to.

How will you know when it has been introduced ? It will be announced in the 'Release Notes'. However, before you go altering your 'userchrome.css' code, you can easily check your Thunderbird by restarting in Troubleshoot mode which auto disables the 'userChrome.css' file whilst in Troubleshoot mode'.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
The code for reducing space - it reduces the number of pixels used between the various rows, eg: between From and To and To and Subject.

It does not reduce the row containing eg: the From data because that height is determined by the font size you are using and the height of the icons used to show whether contact is in address book. It may also change due to your own customised choices which are located: More > Customise. If you choose to include a senders profile image or increase the font of the Subject then those rows will require greater height.

content: This appears to me as a message rejected by receiving server because it cannot be sure of the legitimacy of the sender. This is not uncommon for self-hosted email, such as bluehost and other web hosting companies. You might address this by using a secure setting for sending the messages, but it may require asking Bluehost to investigate the DKIM and SPF settings for the account. This is not something that Thunderbird (or any other email client) can address.

creator: eduardo.carriles

content:
3,000 messages isn't horrible. But just know that pop isn't particularly well suited to having multiple thousands of messages in an Inbox. "Leave messages on server" enabled essentially attempts to mimic an imap environment (in which case why not just change to imap?), and also increases the probability of problems.

> I do have a folder structure of 3 levels deep.

If this is a pop account, there's no way you can be downloading multiple gmail folders to Thunderbird. AFAIK Thunderbird (and any mail client) will only download from the one and only Inbox. If you have three levels deep of folders, then the folders other than Inbox only exist in Thunderbird, or you are doing something highly irregular.

> So when is the very nice team from Thunderbird gonna solve duplicates issues once and for all?

As I recall, as the number of messages in a pop Inbox increases, so increases the probability of causing problems with the local popstate.dat file which is what tracks which messages Thunderbird thinks have been downloaded from the server. If that file is corrupted, is inaccessible/locked, or gets deleted then your entire message store will be redownloaded from the pop server. The first two items I listed can be caused by hardware problems, antivirus SW and backups. You would be wise to explore those two possibilities. Regardless, I do not know of any currently open bug reports that describe your issue, and our experience is the causes tend to be caused by something in the user's environment, which includes network.

Another idea to pursue is disable automatic compact, which the user in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1798300 found to be helpful.

I think only one bug in the past three years has been confirmed, and then fixed in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1796903, which involved the setting "Fetch Headers Only". Another thing you can check in your settings.

The fact that you never see duplicates in the gmail web interface has little bearing on whether or not you will have duplicates in your email client.

Filters are stored in the msgFilterRules.dat file in the account subfolders of Mail and ImapMail of the profile folder, e.g. in Mail/pop.gmail.com or ImapMail/imap.aol.com. The dat file can be copied between accounts on the same or different computers (with TB closed).

Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder, to access the profile.
